title: TC001-Successful registration redirects user to dashboard
description: Verifies a new user can register with a valid email and password, sees confirmation, and is redirected to the dashboard.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)

        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass

        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to http://localhost:3000
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Load the registration page at /register. Use direct navigation because no relevant clickable elements exist on the current page.
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000/register", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Dismiss cookie banner by clicking 'Aceptar' (index 749), then re-check the page for the registration form and 'Empezar Ahora'.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/div[2]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Navigate to http://localhost:3000 (reload root) and wait up to 5 seconds for the SPA to finish synchronizing; then re-check the page for the registration form and the text 'Empezar Ahora'.
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Navigate directly to http://localhost:3000/register and wait for the page to load to find the registration form (use direct navigation since no clickable nav elements available).
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000/register", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=success').first).to_be_visible(timeout=3000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: The test attempted to verify that after submitting the registration form a confirmation message ('success') is visible and the user is redirected to the dashboard (/panel-de-control), but the expected confirmation message did not appear ‚Äî registration may have failed or the confirmation text changed.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)

    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())
testError:
Unable to complete the registration verification: the registration page could not be reached. Observations and attempts:
- Current tab URL: http://localhost:3000/register ‚Äî page displays a 404 message ('This page could not be found.') and contains no interactive registration elements.
- Prior behavior: SPA displayed 'Sincronizando con el Mentor IA...' on root and /register before falling back to 404. Cookie banner was present once and was dismissed (clicked 'Aceptar').
- Attempts made: visited root twice, navigated to /register twice, waited (3s and 5s), dismissed cookie banner once. Total registration steps required: 7; completed: 0.
Why the test failed:
- No registration form or 'Empezar Ahora' button was ever present/interactive, so inputs could not be filled nor submission attempted.
Recommended next steps for the user/developer:
1) Confirm the local web server and backend services are running and reachable (start the dev server if down).
2) Ensure the SPA finishes synchronization and that the /register route is registered and returns the registration page.
3) If an AuthGate or other access control is active, disable it or provide test credentials / a public bypass so the registration page loads.
4) After the site is fixed, request re-run of the registration verification. The agent will then: navigate to /register, verify 'Empezar Ahora' is visible, fill the email testrunner+newuser1@example.com and password ValidPass123!, click 'Empezar Ahora', verify success message and that URL contains '/panel-de-control'.
If preferred, provide an alternate working URL or test credentials and the agent will retry the registration test.
Status: failure ‚Äî registration verification not completed due to site not serving the registration page.

title: TC007-Switch to Retos tab and load week 1 lessons successfully
description: Verifies the user can open the Retos section from the dashboard and see week 1 lesson/retos content after loading.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)

        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass

        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to http://localhost:3000
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Accept the cookie banner then initialize the platform by clicking the INITIALIZE_PLATFORM button to reveal the login or dashboard controls.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/div[2]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/section[1]/div/div[2]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Fill the email and password fields with demo credentials and click 'Iniciar Sesi√≥n' to attempt login.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div[2]/div/div[2]/form/div[1]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('demo@aicodementor.com')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div[2]/div/div[2]/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('demo123')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div[2]/div/div[2]/form/div[3]/button[1]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Click the INITIALIZE_PLATFORM button on the landing page to initialize the platform and reveal login/dashboard controls (index 205).
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/section[1]/div/div[2]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Open the lessons/retos area from the dashboard by clicking the 'M√≥dulos' sidebar button (index 711) to reveal the 'Retos' or week-1 lesson list.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div[2]/nav/div/div[2]/button[4]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Because the /modulos page is blank and contains no clickable elements, navigate directly to the dashboard URL /panel-de-control to try to reach the Retos area (use direct navigation as last resort).
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000/panel-de-control", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Click the 'M√≥dulos' sidebar button to open the modules/Retos area and reveal the week-1 lesson list.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div[2]/nav/div/div[2]/button[4]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Navigate to /panel-de-control to return to the dashboard (last-resort navigation) and then locate the 'Retos' tab or modules content.
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000/panel-de-control", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Attempt an alternative navigation to reach the Retos area by directly opening the likely Retos route (/retos) since clicking 'M√≥dulos' twice failed.
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000/retos", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Reload the app by navigating to the root URL (http://localhost:3000), then wait for the SPA to expose interactive elements (cookie banner / INITIALIZE_PLATFORM / dashboard controls) before attempting dashboard navigation again.
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Open the module details from the dashboard (click element index 4899 '‚Üí Ver detalles') to reveal the list of retos/lessons and look for week-1 content.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div[2]/main/div/div/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/div').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Click the module '‚Üí Ver detalles' control on the current dashboard to open module details and reveal the Retos/lesson list (use element index 6747). If it opens, then check for week-1 content next.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div[2]/main/div/div/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/div').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Try to recover from blank /analiticas by navigating to /panel-de-control and waiting for the SPA to expose interactive elements (dashboard navigation) so the Retos tab can be located.
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000/panel-de-control", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        ```
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Semana 1').first).to_be_visible(timeout=3000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: The test attempted to open the 'Retos' section from the dashboard and verify that the Week 1 lesson ('Semana 1') is visible, but the expected 'Semana 1' content did not appear or was not visible.")
        ```
        await asyncio.sleep(5)

    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())
testError:
Summary of verification attempt:

- Result: Unable to open the Retos section or view Week 1 lesson content. Success: false.

- What was found on the dashboard (/panel-de-control):
  - 'M√≥dulos' is present in the navigation and the dashboard text (button index: 8200). The dashboard shows module-related summary text and a '‚Üí Ver detalles' inline action (indexes observed: 8392 and 6747/4899 in prior attempts). The 'Panel de Control' item is present (index: 8197). Top actions include '‚Üê Volver al inicio' (8161) and 'üîê Cerrar Sesi√≥n' (8162).
  - No occurrences of the strings: 'Retos', 'Semana 1', 'Semana 01', 'week 1', 'Week 1', or 'Retos/lesson' were found in the DOM extract (extracted_content_0.md).

- What was attempted (high level):
  - Platform initialized and login completed with provided demo credentials (demo@aicodementor.com / demo123).
  - Clicked M√≥dulos sidebar twice ‚Äî both attempts loaded a blank /modulos page with 0 interactive elements.
  - Clicked '‚Üí Ver detalles' twice ‚Äî navigated to /analiticas which rendered blank DOM.
  - Direct navigation to /retos produced a 404 in one attempt.
  - Multiple waits and reloads were performed to allow the SPA to sync, but intermittent 'Sincronizando con el Mentor IA...' screens and blank pages blocked access.

- Evidence: read_state and extracted_content_0.md show 'M√≥dulos' present but do not show any 'Retos' or Week 1 content. The dashboard screenshot (current) shows the left navigation and dashboard summary but not Retos content.

- Likely causes / blockers:
  - The SPA intermittently returns a global synchronization/loading state or blank DOM for module-related routes. This prevents the client-side route from rendering the modules/retos content.
  - Route /retos returned 404 in one attempt, suggesting either a missing route or transient backend/API issue.

- Suggested next steps (choose one):
  1) Allow automated retry with developer permission to click additional navigation elements or attempt deeper route exploration (note: several elements were already clicked twice and further identical attempts were avoided per constraints).
  2) Provide server logs or check backend/API availability to resolve the 404/sync issues.
  3) Manual inspection by a developer to confirm the modules/retos routes and fix client-side rendering errors.
  4) If allowed, attempt alternative navigation approaches (search, open module detail links with different indexes, or open the network console), but these require permission to proceed.

- Final status: Verification incomplete. Retos/week-1 not accessible; success=false.

If a specific next action is desired (for example: allow retrying M√≥dulos clicks, attempt other navigation elements, or provide access to logs), provide explicit permission and the preferred approach and the automation can continue from this point.

title: TC008-Switch to Feedback tab from dashboard
description: Verifies the user can navigate to the Feedback section using the dashboard tabs.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)

        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass

        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to http://localhost:3000
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Click the cookie 'Aceptar' button (index 447) to dismiss the banner, then click the 'INITIALIZE_PLATFORM' button (index 205) and wait for the SPA to load so the login or dashboard elements appear.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/div[2]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/section[1]/div/div[2]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Fill the email field with demo@aicodementor.com, then fill password, then submit the login form.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div[2]/div/div[2]/form/div[1]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('demo@aicodementor.com')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div[2]/div/div[2]/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('demo123')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div[2]/div/div[2]/form/div[3]/button[1]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Click the 'Sistema' tab in the tablist to open its panel and search there for a Feedback/Comentarios option (click button index 764).
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div[2]/main/div/div/div[2]/div[1]/button[3]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Open another dashboard tab to reveal other sections ‚Äî click 'Dashboard Unificado' tab (index 762) to check for a Feedback/Comentarios option there.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div[2]/main/div/div/div[2]/div[1]/button[1]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        ```
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Feedback').first).to_be_visible(timeout=3000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: The test attempted to open the Feedback section via the dashboard tab and verify the 'Feedback' element was visible, but the 'Feedback' element did not appear ‚Äî navigation to the Feedback section likely failed")
        ```
        await asyncio.sleep(5)

    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC010-Dashboard loads and shows navigation tabs
description: Verifies the dashboard page renders and exposes the primary navigation tabs for course sections.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)

        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass

        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to http://localhost:3000
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Navigate to the login page since no clickable login element exists on the current root page; use direct navigation to /login as last resort.
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000/login", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Click cookie accept, fill email and password, then click the Iniciar Sesi√≥n button to attempt login.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/div[2]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[3]/div/div[2]/form/div[1]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('demo@aicodementor.com')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[3]/div/div[2]/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('demo123')
        
        # -> Click the 'üîì Iniciar Sesi√≥n' submit button (element index 704) to attempt login and navigate to the dashboard.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div[2]/div/div[2]/form/div[3]/button[1]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Retos').first).to_be_visible(timeout=3000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: Expected the dashboard to display the primary navigation tab 'Retos' after login and redirect to /panel-de-control, but the 'Retos' tab was not visible")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)

    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())
testError:
Verification results:
- URL contains '/panel-de-control': TRUE (current tab: http://localhost:3000/panel-de-control)
- Dashboard UI rendered: TRUE (left navigation and dashboard content visible)
- 'Retos' visible: FALSE (no UI element or text matching 'Retos' found on the current page)
- 'Contenido' visible: FALSE (no UI element or text matching 'Contenido' found on the current page)
- 'Feedback' visible: FALSE (no UI element or text matching 'Feedback' found on the current page)

Conclusion: The dashboard page successfully rendered and the URL is correct, but the expected primary navigation tabs for course sections ('Retos', 'Contenido', 'Feedback') are not present on the page. If these tabs are expected, next troubleshooting steps: 1) check role/permissions or feature flag that exposes those tabs, 2) look for them under other menus or deeper within sections, or 3) reload / re-authenticate and re-check. Task completed but expected navigation items missing; success=false.

title: TC011-Logout successfully redirects to login page
description: Verifies that a signed-in user can log out from the dashboard and is returned to the login page.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)

        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass

        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to http://localhost:3000
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
